revised_title: Cytokinin Activity of Substituted Ureas and Thioureas: Structure-Activity Relationships
tldr: The authors tested the cytokinin activity of over 500 substituted ureas and thioureas, discovering structure-activity relationships and formulating principles for their biological activity. They found that certain chemical structures, such as phenyl urea and specific bridge arrangements, were more active than others. The study provides insights into the development of plant growth regulators.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Plant Biology
